fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-43981].
  {panel}

re: JRA-43836, this isn't the first time a JIRACloud update has killed webhooks.  For me specifically, this is a really bad outcome, as my cloud addon is dependent on them.  All my customers got an outage because of this, some may still not know there is a problem.  I don't know who has the problem because I can't guage status, which leads me to:

As a Cloud addon, I have no way to validate the 'heath' of the core Atlassian Connect infrastructure (of which webhooks are a part).  Some potential options:  

# Atlassian could implement some post instance startup validation to sanity check things like 'is webhooks enabled / usable' (specifically talking of JIRACloud here, so Atlassian can 'know' about the problem at boot time, rather than customer feedback time ;))
# Atlassian could create an Hourly Webhook 'Im alive' POST including a payload of internal healthheck status.  This allows addons to track when a host was last 'healthy', potentially communicating to host owner about that.  (possible, but Id rather not get auto pinged to death, if I got a webhook 5m ago, I dont need to know webhooks are healthy)
# Atlassian could add a new REST service to divulge internal health check would make all manner of 3rd party monitoring possible, Pingdom : "webhooks : enabled" etc.  I would find this very handy. (possibly valid for JIRAserver as well as JIRACloud, being able to locally in an addon, know I hadn't got a webhook for more than an hour, could start polling health to check status, taking notification action as necessary)
fields.summary: How to verify JIRACloud webhook functionality is working

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Embedding a SWF attachment in a comment or description should work, using the syntax {noformat}!ClearExternalNoVol.swf!{noformat}

see example: !ClearExternalNoVol.swf!  
also see example comment below

h3. Environment
* Chrome 43 on mac
* Firefox 37.0.1 on mac
* Safari 8.0.6 on mac

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Attach a swf to a ticket and embed it in a comment using {!attachment.swf!} 
# The swf does not render

h3. Expected Results
The swf file should be rendered in the comment, as per JIRA comment help: https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/WikiRendererHelpAction.jspa?section=attachments

h3. Notes
This may be due to the browsers handling of Flash files, we should supply some sort of solution as it is documented that we support this. (The latest version of Flash is installed despite the message about the missing plugin in the screenshot)

h3.Workaround
The attachment can be downloaded, then opened in the browser to view.
fields.summary: Embedding a SWF attachment in a comment does not render
Filter summary info partly hidden, especially dates

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-43977].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Our QA team loves attaching swf movies (from Jing) showing steps to reproduce a defect. However with JIRA it turns what should be a simple process into a multi-step pain.

h3. Suggested Solution
# Click attachment. Browser navigates to attachment directly and plays it in the same window

h3. Workaround
# Click attachment
# Jira sends attachment with mime-type application/octet-stream so that the browser will prompt to download it
# Chrome offers to "Keep" or "discard" it. Click "Keep"
# Find & drag attachment from its download location into a browser window
# After watching movie, go find useless swf and delete it
fields.summary: As a user, I want SWF attachments (from Jing) to play in the browser

fields.description:
Since our upgrade to JIRA v6.4.6 we noticed that the thumbnail quality is very bad :

I noticed you changed the thumbnail algorithm (similar issue raised in JRA-43200), but the new algorithm made the thumbnail un-usable (cf attached pictures : it seems that the thumbnail is just picking 1 pixel over 4 pixels... so on this example the result is horrible).

Please at least provide us a workaround, or a switch to fall back to the previous quality.
fields.summary: Snapshot thumbnails have a very bad quality in 6.4.6
REST endpoint /rest/api/2/user documentation is incorrect

JIRA Version 6.4.7

How to Reproduce.

1. In Evolution application (email client) save messages in it's native format.

2. Save filename with symbols, ':' , ';' etc.

3. Attach file to message, receive error message "File name cannot contain the character ':'"

4a. *(Expected)* Attach file to ticket, receive error message "Filename cannot contain the character ':'.

4b. *(Actual )* Attach file to ticket, receive error message "Internal Server Error occured"

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-43960].
  {panel}

h4. Description:
Shared filters page shows usernames of filter owners, even for not logged users. This is not desirable since an attacker can utilize the usernames for in a brute force or dictionary attack.

h4. Steps to reproduce:
# As an unauthenticated user, run a search for any term.
# The results pages has a "Find Filters" link
# Clicking on the "Find Filters" link redirects to a page with an option for "Popular".
# Clicking "Popular" lists filters "Shared with all users" and the usernames of authors of those filters.

h4. Suggestion:
Hide the owner of the filter when an unauthenticated user tries to search for it. Alternatively, you can consider hiding only the username of the owner and show only its complete name.
fields.summary: Shared filters page display username of filter owners for public
warning: ignoring option MaxPermSize=384m; support was removed in 8.0

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When pasting data to a field by inline-editting , it does not retain its original alignment and paragraphing. Affect IE 9 and 11, Chrome unaffected.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# To reproduce. Create a Text file in Notepad containing 3 lines, for example
{noformat}
Line 1
Line 2
Line 3
{noformat}
# Copy the text from the notepad file
# Browse an issue in JIRA. 
# Without selecting edit, double click on a description field and paste. 
# Note the line endings are lost. Repeating the same in Chrome retains the line endings.

h3. Expected Results
* Data should be pasted similar to the format it was copied (holding the allignment in place)

h3. Actual Results
* Data is pasted in the field without the alignment

h3.Workaround
* Paste the data to a Microsoft Office Word or any equivalent application, then, proceed to paste this to your JIRA in IE.
fields.summary: Alignment missing when pasting data to field.

fields.description:
h4. +Steps to reproduce+
# Open Issue Navigator in Basic search mode
# Click the Status drop-down menu to view the list of available statuses
# Hover a status for its tooltip to pop up
# *Click on the tooltip*
# Mouse out or click somewhere else

h4. +Expected behavior+
Tooltip auto disappears

h4. +Actual behavior+
Tooltip remains on the screen

h4. +Notes+
# This can be replicated in JAC:
!tooltip.png|thumbnail!
# Happens in Chrome, Firefox, and IE11
# Happens in both Detail and List View
# Nothing is seen from F12 Developer tools
# Any action that triggers a page refresh will sweep all the tooltips
fields.summary: Status Tooltip does not disappear upon being clicked

h3. Summary
After JIRA database connection is lost, stopping JIRA service hangs at "Stopping" status till the database connection is up. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Make sure database is up.
# Start JIRA service and access JIRA (such as login to JIRA).
# Stop database service using Windows service console (Open the Control Panel (icons view), click on the Administrative Tools icon, click on Services).
# Stop JIRA service. JIRA service will stuck in "Stopping" status.

h3. Expected Results
Able to stop the JIRA service gracefully even when there is no database connection.

h3. Actual Results
JIRA service hangs at "Stopping" status till database connection is up.

h3.Workaround
Can kill the JIRA process in "force" status. Use the windows command below:

sc queryex <service name>
{noformat}
For example JIRA service name is "JIRA290515092212". The result is:
{noformat}
SERVICE_NAME: JIRA290515092212
        TYPE               : 10  WIN32_OWN_PROCESS

        FLAGS              :
{noformat}

{noformat}

{noformat}

h3. Problem Definition
The JIRA login screen does not allow any customization to place company required messages.

h3. Suggested Solution

h3. Summary

When upgrading from one version of JIRA / Confluence Server to a newer, we can only see if plugins are compatible. Some of these plugins may no longer be free as well. Being able to see if a plugin was ever implemented / used would be helpful in determining which plugins / addons needed to be carried over into the new version.

h3. Environment
This would apply to Server versions of JIRA and Confluence only.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go through upgrade process
# Output list of all currently installed plugins / addons

h3. Expected Results
# Go through upgrade process
# Output list of all currently installed plugins / addons
# List indicates if there is a newer version available, is paid or free, has been used or not

h3. Actual Results
# Go through upgrade process
# Output list of all currently installed plugins / addons
# List indicates if there is a newer version available

fields.description:
h3. Summary
# This bug is related to closed bug ticket https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-8950
# When the Current Assignee is given the Browse Project Permission, other users are able to view this Project. 
# They can't necessarily view issues or create issues, but they can see the project from the *View All Projects* page.
# They are also able to see the project name at the project filter on the Issue Search navigator but no issues will be displayed. Only the name of the filter at Projects. When trying to search issues from restricted projects it will show "No issues were found to match your search" which is good. 


h3. Steps to Reproduce
1. ensure to have a jira instance with several projects e.g 'Project A' and 'Project B' - Done
2. ensure to have at least two different permission schemes e.g. 'Permission Scheme A' and 'Permission Scheme B' - Done
3. ensure to that e.g. 'Project A' uses the 'Permission Scheme A' and 'Project B' uses the 'Permission Scheme B' - Done
!s1.png|thumbnail!

4. ensure that the 'Browse Project' permission is restricted to the appropriate project roles in each permission scheme e.g. to the project role 'Tester' -Done
!s2.png|thumbnail!
!s3.png|thumbnail!
5. ensure that e.g. 'User A' is assigned as 'Tester' to 'Project A' only, while 'User B' is assigned as 'Tester' to 'Project B' - Done
!s5.png|thumbnail!
!s6.png|thumbnail!

h3. Expected Results:
User A is not supposed to be able to see Project B at all. 

h3. Actual Results:
User A is able to see Project A at various places :
1. View All Projects
!s7.png|thumbnail!
2. Issue Navigator
!s8.png|thumbnail!

h3.Workaround
* Remove Current Assignee on Browse Projects Permission
fields.summary: Current Assignee on Browse Projects Permission displayed Projects to All Users

h3. Problem Definition
Outgoing JIRA email get stucked at mail queue if the user on Exchange has set to block JIRA email address. Hence, this situation creates load in mail queue and all the mail will be on the error mail queue as well. 

h3. Suggested Solution
The ability to specify somewhere in JIRA to exclude those user's email that has been set to block in Exchange.  

OR

To make JIRA to put those email with certain error (such as "User 'username' does not have permission") to placed in another queue to avoid in increasing in mail queue load.
fields.summary: To have ability to exclude user that has been blocked in Exchange

h3. Problem Definition

The Internet Explorer MIME Sniffing Security Hole Workaround Policy in [Configuring JIRA Options|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Configuring+JIRA+Options] can be confusing - it is also not consistent. It will allow PNGs and block JPGs. It's also not entirely clear of the behaviour of it, for example in JRA-28965.

h3. Suggested Solution

Remove the Internet Explorer MIME Sniffing Security Hole Workaround Policy functionality - IE7 has not been supported in JIRA for quite some time.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-43904].
  {panel}

Users accidentally lose their intended searches because they do the following:

1. User types in a JQL
2. User clicks "Save" before running the search
3. JIRA happily saves the search *before* the user typed in the new JQL.
4. The UI doesn't prompt the user that the JQL has since changed since the last run. <-- this is the main failure point.

This problem is a vector for other problems on large JIRA instances (JRA-35627) which causes users to create a filter for every issue in the instance. This can lead to crashes when users use this filter on a:

* JIRA Agile Scrum board: GHS-12171
* Or a Two-Dimensional filter against all issues on your system split by assignee/project.

Try the above two on any instance with a million issues and it'll crash the system.
fields.summary: Saving search filters UX discards a user's intended search

"0 0 * * *" - is not every hour, it is must be 00:00

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-43888].
  {panel}

h4. +Steps to reproduce+
# Connect JIRA to an external user directory
# Create a project and set Project Lead to one of the external users
# *Disable the external user directory*, so that the Project Lead's user account is removed from JIRA
# Go to Projects dropdown menu -> View All Projects and perform a project search

h4. +Expected behavior+
Projects can be filtered using the keyword

h4. +Actual behaviors+
# The search function does not work and projects can't be filtered
# The project with the external Project Lead states that it has no Project Lead:
!projects.png|thumbnail!
# The browser URL is not appended with {{&contains=<keyword>}}
# The browser F12 Console shows this JS error:
!console.png|thumbnail!

h4. +Workaround+
# Find all the projects with the same problem from JIRA Administration -> Projects
# Go to their Administration Panel -> Roles -> update Project Lead to an Active User
!project_lead.png|thumbnail!

(i) If there're too many projects to update, the following SQL query can be used to search for them in the database:
{code}select * from project where lead not in (select lower_user_name from cwd_user);{code}
Then the following query can be used to update the Project Lead of these projects to a valid username:
{code}update project set lead = '<an_active_username_in_lowercase>' where lead not in (select lower_user_name from cwd_user);{code}
(!) the username must be in lowercase
(i) JIRA needs restarting (and maybe re-indexing) for the change to take effect

h4. +Notes+
# Project Search always fails under All Projects category, because it definitely contains one or more problematic projects
# Similarly, it fails under those Categories which contain one or more problematic projects
# For those Categories without a problematic project, Project Filter works, no matter how many pages there are
fields.summary: Project Search does not work if a Project has a Project Lead in a disabled directory

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-43883].
  {panel}

"Follow Referrals" is on by default for the AD connector, but off by default for other connectors.

This option uses the node referral (JNDI lookup java.naming.referral) configuration setting. It is generally needed for Active Directory servers configured without proper DNS, to prevent a 'javax.naming.PartialResultException: Unprocessed Continuation Reference(s)' error.

However, with proper DNS it is often not required, and can cause multiple issues that can be difficult to diagnose.

Is it possible to turn it off by default, and/or have some more detailed explanation of when it is required in the docs/in product?

Examples issues this can cause:
* [Confluence PartialResultExceptions|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFKB/User+Lookups+Fail+With+%27PartialResultExceptions%27+Due+to+Active+Directory+%27Follow+Referrals%27+Configuration]
* [JIRA PartialResultExceptions|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/User+Lookups+Fail+With+%27PartialResultExceptions%27+Due+to+Active+Directory+%27follow+referrals%27+Configuration]
fields.summary: Disable "Follow Referrals" in the AD Connector by default

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa} *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-43881]. {panel} JIRA uses clipboard-unfriendly HTML and CSS to display the issue key and summary title on many pages (like the one you're reading right now). This makes it unnecessarily hard to copy and paste the key and summary into an email or other document (something I do 5+ times per day). JIRA could make small changes to its HTML markup and CSS that would not change how the page looks but would make it much easier to copy, paste, and share JIRA info with the outside world. In particular: * title and summary should show up as a single line of text in text-only clipboard clients * formatting should be easy to repair for rich-text clients after pasting To repro: * on this page, use the mouse to select both the issue key and summary * copy selection to clipboard * paste into the title of an Outlook email (or Google Docs or Word or ...) Expected: 1 line of text, because that's all that will fit into an Outlook email title. Ideally text that's a normal font size. And formatted like this: JIRA-1234 - Make it easier to copy key and summary. Actual: * In outlook email titles, only the issue key shows up. You'll need to paste the clipboard somewhere else, remove the newline, then paste into the email * In rich-text apps (Google docs, Word, etc.) you'll get a one-line list (which breaks any bullet points you paste into) and then a second paragraph of the summary in a huge font. * If you use Word's/Outlook's "Merge Formatting" feature to try to match the formatting to your document, you end up with the issue key being 1. in a numbered list because the key is inside an LI element in HTML. Possible Solution: By making a few minor HTML and CSS changes, and without making any changes to how your key + summary HTML is displayed, you could make a big improvement in how this content is pasted. Here's what I did in Firebug as a proof of concept: 1. changed the OL/LI elements currently used for the project name and key to SPAN elements with similar CSS. This is the first step to get plain-text clipboard clients (e.g. Outlook mail titles) to treat the selection as one line instead of two. This change also prevents problematic impact on bullet points and also enables Word/Outlook Merge Formatting to work correctly. 2. added a SPAN after the issue key with content of " - " and style="color:transparent". This adds a " - " after the issue key that won't be normally visible (it's transparent!) but will be copied to the clipboard. 3. wrapped the H1 issue summary title with a DIV with style="display: inline-block; width: 100%;". This is the second part of convincing clipboard clients that this is a one-line block of text. Steps 1-3 above enable a single line of plain text to be pasted. Whoo-hoo! But rich-text clipboard clients (e.g. Word, Google Docs) still display the text as two lines because the H1 is recognized as a line-breaking block element, even when wrapped inside that sneaky inline-block DIV. But, if you're willing to change the H1 element, then you can get all the text onto one line in all clients using step #4 below: 4. Change the H1 to a SPAN with similar CSS as the H1. I used this CSS: display: inline-block; font-size: 24px; margin-top: -2px; margin-bottom: -2px; This is still not perfect because the text is in a big font size, but it's massively better than the current state. Below is the Firebugged HTML after steps 1-4 above. I'm not suggesting you should implement exactly like this, but only want to illustrate that minor HTML and CSS changes could improve usability in an important part of the product without changing how the page looks. {{
Seed Web / AEON-10353 - Reports cannot be viewed in chrome on iPad
}}
fields.summary: Non-visible HTML/CSS tweaks could ease copying of issue key & summary to clipboard

fields.description:
h3. +Summary+

As per [JIRA 7.4 Supported Platforms|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver074/supported-platforms-881683157.html], JIRA supports Microsoft SQL Server databases using the latest [JTDS JDBC driver|http://jtds.sourceforge.net/]. This driver however doesn't support SQL Server AlwaysOn Availability Groups.

Microsoft JDBC driver, on the other hand, [supports AlwaysOn Availability Groups|https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/sql/connect/jdbc/jdbc-driver-support-for-high-availability-disaster-recovery] but is not mentioned in the Supported Platforms. 

Thus, it's unclear whether AlwaysOn Availability Groups is not supported or Microsoft JDBC driver is not supported.

(i) This may be related to the fact that Clustered Databases are not officially supported.
h3. +Suggestion+

It should be well documented whether Microsoft JDBC driver is supported or not, regardless of whether AlwaysOn Availability Groups is supported. For example [Bamboo currently supports Microsoft JDBC driver|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bamboo/supported-platforms-289276764.html].

Moreover, since Clustered Databases are being used more popularly nowadays, and we offer Data Center solutions for a similar objective of High Availability, it would be great that Clustered Databases are supported by JIRA (and other Atlassian products).

(+) JIRA currently works well with SQL Server AlwaysOn when using Microsoft JDBC driver, however this is not officially tested by Atlassian.
fields.summary: Support SQL Server AlwaysOn Availability Groups with Microsoft JDBC driver

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Logged in and logged out user are seeing different size of window for the issue collector. Logged out user are seeing small size issue collector window and logged in user are seeing full size issue collector window. Inconsistence behavior of the issue collector.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Configure the Issue Collector Form

Template set to :  Custom

Message : 
*_if no message define, the window will be very small, if there are message define, window will be larger_*

When Match reporter is set to :
*Attempt to match user session of submitter or submitter email address*
* Logged in user : will see full window
* Logged out user : Will see small window

*Always use Issue Reporter*
* Logged in user : Will see small window
* Logged out user : Will see small window

h3. Expected Results
* Should be seeing complete window size for the issue collector

h3. Actual Results
When Match reporter is set to :
*Attempt to match user session of submitter or submitter email address*
* Logged in user : will see full window
* Logged out user : Will see small window

*Always use Issue Reporter*
* Logged in user : Will see small window
* Logged out user : Will see small window

h3.Workaround
* Do not use custom template / Define a longer message under Issue Collector Form > Message
fields.summary: Issue Collector Small Window Size

fields.description:
h5. Summary
When a user imports his backup.xml from JIRA 5.X to a JIRA 6.4.5 instance, the users or groups allowed in the *Transition Issue* permission differs based on when he imported the data(during installation or after installation)

h5. Steps to Reproduce
(i) Ensure that the *Transition Issue Permission* in the 5.X instance has been modified before you backup the instance.

*Test 1*
# Download and Install JIRA 6.4.5
# When Installation is completed, import the backup into JIRA.
# Check your project with the modified transition issue permission.

h5. Result
The  permission matches what you had configured in JIRA 5.X

*Test 2*
# Download and Install JIRA 6.4.5
# While installing, when you get to the page that allows you import your data, select the option to import your backup.xml and import the data.
# Check your project with the modified transition issue permission.

h5. Expected Result
The permission should match that of JIRA 5.X or at least match that of *Test 1*.

h5. Actual Result
This permission would contain only 2 user/group:
- Single User
- Project Role(Developer)

This result can be seen in the image attached below:
!Import Bug.PNG|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Transition Permission Different Depending on when Data is restored in JIRA

fields.description:
h2. Steps to reproduce
Install a fresh JIRA instance

h2. Expected behaviour 
The Gzip compression should be set as OFF by default (as mentioned [in this documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Configuring+JIRA+Options]) 

h2. Actual behaviour 
Gzip compression is set as ON

 
 Either the defaults need to be changed or the documentation needs to be updated. This is causing a lot of problems for the customers using mod_proxy.
fields.summary: Gzip compression should be set as OFF but is set as ON by default.

  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-43858].
  {panel}

We are facing problems about saving data during edit issue.

1. Click edit button
2. update issue
3. click Save 

Nothing happened after 3rd step, and from develop tools, we found error in console(attached the screenshot).
And inside of JIRA log, we found following errors:

{{May 18, 2015 11:09:40 AM org.apache.coyote.http11.AbstractHttp11Processor process
INFO: Error parsing HTTP request header
 Note: further occurrences of HTTP header parsing errors will be logged at DEBUG level.}}

Workaround:
1. Copy the content from input textbox into notepad and clean the form.
2. Save the edit screen.
3. click edit issue
4. Copy content from notepad into input textbox of edit screen
5. Save, and it will be saved successfully.

And, this problem is not happening in IE browser.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If an anchor is added to the beginning of a comment that is somewhere in the middle of other comments, and the list of issue comments is big enough to see a collapsed view, clicking on a link to this anchor will land you in the right comment, but somewhere in the middle of the comment rather than the beginning of the comment where the anchor is placed.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an issue
# Add about 20 comments, with roughly 20 lines each. 
# Edit comment number 16 for instance and add this anchor tag directly at the beginning of the list line:
{code}{anchor:here}{code}.
# Now create a link to this anchor - for instance in the description field with: "\[#here\]", and clink on this anchor reference to take you to the anchor.

h3. Expected Results
The expected behavior is to land at the beginning of the comment where the anchor has been placed.

h3. Actual Results
The link takes you to the right comment but somewhere near the middle of the comment. see screenshot:
!screenshot1.png|thumbnail!

h3. Workaround

There is currently no workaround for this issue.
fields.summary: Anchor links don't link to exact Anchor location.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-43851].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
Inserting an image via toolbar's Insert Image throws error "Unable to render embedded object" 

h3. Environment
* Safari with Western Encoding
* JIRA

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Use Safari, and ensure encoding is set to default Western ISO
# Attach an image on JIRA with a title including accented characters (e.g. é)
# Use the insert image option from your toolbar: !Screen Shot 2015-06-16 at 14.42.05.jpg|thumbnail!

h3. Expected Results
In Chrome and Firefox, attaching in this way does display the thumbnail.

h3. Actual Results
In Safari, you receive this error:
{noformat}
Unable to render embedded object: File (FILENAME) not found.
{noformat}

h3.Workaround
Change default encoding to UTF-8, or try in another browser, such as Firefox or Chrome.
fields.summary: Inserting attached image with accented characters unable to render

fields.description:

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-43848].
  {panel}

Currently, all status are displayed on the issue navigator regardless of what the user's project permission is. It would be great if the Status filter can only display status based on the user's project permission ( Browser Project ). Please refer to the example below :

1. User is only granted Browser project permission for both 2 Projects :
* Test Group (TG)
*  TestGrou2 (TESS)

!pro1.png|thumbnail!

2. But all Status , even for projects which are restricted to this user is displayed 
!pro2.png|thumbnail!

3. When the user selects the project that is visible to him , then the Status filter will only show status related to both the projects. 
!pro3.png|thumbnail!
!pro4.png|thumbnail!

Hence, it would be great it the Status filter only displays Status that are associated with the Browser Permission Project Permission given to the user. 

Showing unrelated statuses to this user is not efficient and can be confusing.
fields.summary: Limit Status Filter at Issue Navigator Based on Project Permission

The error in the UI is sufficient to let the user know what's wrong and how to correct it. Such big stack traces for such a simple error is not needed



h3. Suggested Solution
Remove the stack trace from the logs when a user runs an invalid JQL, or set it to a different level so it doesn't fill up the logs every time a user runs it

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-43845].
  {panel}

*Scenario*
- Setup new email handler with the option to "creates new issue or comment when email received".
-* Do not give the permission to create users.
- Send an email to the mail handler that contains users in CC section of email(the users *must* not be JIRA users).

*Actual Result:*
JIRA Creates issue but ignores the users that were in CC list as they are not JIRA users.

*Wanted Result*
JIRA would store these emails somewhere within the ticket created and send updates to them as with original CC expectation, without making these users JIRA users nor would they be added to the watcher list.
fields.summary: Allow JIRA Store CCs that are not JIRA Users

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-43844].
  {panel}

h3. ***Current Behavior***

When creating a new sub-task, the default status of the subtask would be based on the workflow of the associated issue type.


h3. ***Feature Request***

We would like to have the option to set all newly created sub-task to the status of the parent issue.


{panel:title=Original Request}
1.	What are the current issues that you face with the existing feature?
The current behaviour (as you have specified) using an OnDemand Jira instance, is limiting me from having separate boards for Planning and In Progress/Daily Standup work. My choices with the current implementation are

1. To have a single kanban board for all stories in our backlog as well as work currently in play (which has the significant negative effect of making our preferred Epic Based Swimlanes impractical, due to long lists of planned work that need to be scrolled through to get to the next Epic of work in Progress), or 
2. To keep flitting back-and-forth between Planning boards and In Progress boards to move sub-tasks through the planning statuses and into the In Progress statuses. 
The way that we run agile, we rarely create sub-tasks until our stories are taken into our In Progress statuses, as we tend not to do detailed analysis until the story is ready to play.

2.	What would you like to be able to do in the future?
Full description of the requested feature
I would like to have the option to specify the status that I want sub-tasks to be created in. Ideally I would like them to be created in the To Do Column of my In Progress board if the story is already represented in a status on that board, or, in the case of a story that is still in a status of my Planning board, to be created in the status of the parent story. I realise this is quite complex to implement, so I would be happy with a limited solution of having the option to just create the sub-tasks in the same status as the parent issue from which they are created (at least this way I could ensure they are on the same board as the parent issue)

3.	How would you like this feature to behave?
Any ideas you may have on how the desired feature should be implemented. (If any) 
I would propose having a Post Condition on the Create Transition in the Workflow that allowed me to specify that "if the issuetype is sub-task, then set status to that of the parent issue".
I realise that you are unable to guarantee this feature request will be implemented, or if so, offer an ETA on the work, but I wish to emphasise that this is really hindering all our teams on a daily basis. I am currently in the process of rolling out JIRA across my organisation, and whilst the teams I have already migrated are generally really pleased with the functionality offered by JIRA over their previous system, this is a constant source of frustration to them.
{panel}
fields.summary: Set the Default status of a Sub-Task based on the Parent Issue Status

fields.description:
Hey,

If you create a comment in JIRA using apples emojis, your comment will not save.
In the logs you get an error:
[jira.rest.exception.ExceptionInterceptor] Returning internal server error in response
java.lang.reflect.InvocationTargetException

There you can see, that the emoji is like "😀".

Please fix this error. Using an emoji should not break the whole comment. Just delete this "foreign characters" or replace them with some characters. For example: Outlook replaces the emojis with normal a-z characters.
fields.summary: Comments with Apple Emoji not stored
